meanings.sent1: During the debate, Sarah outsays all her opponents with her strong arguments.
meanings.sent2: She always outsays her classmates when it comes to sharing stories.
meanings.sent3: At the family gathering, little Timmy outsays everyone by telling jokes non-stop.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for the topic outsays any doubts others may have.
meanings.sent5: The teacher outsays the students with her knowledge and experience.

meanings.definition: To speak louder or more frequently than someone else.
meanings.sent1: In the crowded room, he outsays everyone to make sure his voice is heard.
meanings.sent2: During the argument, she tends to outsay her partner, making it hard to find a resolution.
meanings.sent3: The parrot outsays the other birds in the pet shop, drawing attention with its loud squawks.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outsays the silence in the room, bringing joy to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves outsays the chatter of the seagulls on the beach.
